title: How Netflix Killed Blockbuster
description: A quick win: understand How Netflix Killed Blockbuster.

hook.text: Blockbuster had 9,000 stores and laughed when Netflix offered to sell for $50 million.

buildup.text: Netflix started mailing DVDs with no late fees. Blockbuster's $800 million in late fees was its weakness.

discovery.text: Then Netflix pivoted to streamingâ€”a subscription model that eliminated shipping costs entirely.

twist.text: Blockbuster launched its own streaming service. But it was too lateâ€”Netflix had the subscriber base.

climax.text: By 2010, Blockbuster filed for bankruptcy. Netflix now has over 200 million subscribers worldwide.

punchline.text: The giant laughed, then the giant fell.
